svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
July 9, 2022" date: "2022-07-09"
• Sepolia testnet merged successfully : TTD config issue specific to PoW testnets
• TTD config issue specific to PoW testnets
• Mainnet-shadow-fork-9 merges July 14, plan to test MEV-boost
• Tim Beiko’s core devs update : stakers prepare for merge, block times back to ~13s after Gray Glacier upgrade, testnets being deprecated
• Latest core devs call video . Notes from Tim Beiko and Christine Kim : Goerli merge TTD to be set at next PoS implementers or core devs
call Discussion of Latest Valid Hash edge cases MEV-boost discussion
• Goerli merge TTD to be set at next PoS implementers or core devs call
• Discussion of Latest Valid Hash edge cases
• Erigon v2022.07.02-alpha : passes all 114 engine Hive tests
• Besu v22.4.4 : fixes for snap-sync & state root mismatch/worldstate unavailable
• Geth fix for regression impacting merge sync on Sepolia and Ropsten testnets
• KZG ceremony call video : audit of SDK output mid-August, audit of full system end-October, spec to be made executable
• Nimbus: light proxy becomes possible using beacon chain light client protocol post-merge
• foobar: Proof of Stake explainer with common misconceptions
• Aztec Connect (privacy zk rollup) live on mainnet; zk.money DeFi aggregator supports Element and Lido
• Proposal for Layer2 bridge risk framework
• Hop transfer delays post mortem during Arbitrum Odyssey bridging
This newsletter is made possible thanks to Hardhat !
Hardhat has just released a refreshed experience for new projects: Hardhat Toolbox . With minimal boilerplate and set up effort, it's the
best way to get started with building for Ethereum .
Hardhat Toolbox packs most of the functionality you'll need into a single package. No additional plugins required to get started. It also
includes a new replacement for hardhat-waffle that is tightly integrated with Hardhat which offers extra features and better error
Check out the announcement for more information, and install Hardhat 2.10.0 to try it out!
• Hardhat v2.10.0 + Hardhat Toolbox opinionated bundle of plugins: deploy & interact with ethers.js, test with Mocha & Chai, interact with
Hardhat Network, verify on Etherscan, gas reporting, test coverage and type bindings for TypeScript
• Hardhat for Visual Studio Code out of beta
• surl (http library): make web requests from Solidity scripts & tests
• stack-packer : generate Solidity library for packed structs on the stack
• Fe v0.19.1-alpha : return nested structs, adopts curly braces, traits as bounds for generic functions and complex types as array
• Semaphore v2 : create private identities, add identities to groups & send anonymous signals
• Yield roll over vulnerability disclosed , $10k bounty
• Axie/Ronin bridge $600million exploit entry point was fake job offer PDF
• samczsun breaks down an attempted attack using a crypto stealer
• ethOS (mobile OS) supports unlocked Pixel 3 & 5a; light node, OTA updates
• Maker DAO approves $100 million vault for US bank
• Aave proposes GHO collateral-backed USD stablecoin
• Tornado Cash Classic UI open sourced
• Waku is hiring Software & DevRel Engineer and Product Marketing Manager
• Ethereum Foundation seek a Front End Developer
• GridPlus hiring a Go/protocol dev for the private, scalable PhononDAO
• Nexus Mutual: Frontend/Solidity : Help build the web3 Risk Marketplace
• Taiko ZKRollup: hiring senior golang & rust backend developers .
• Status hiring: Comms & Activism Director , React Native UI & C++, Qt/QML Devs
Job listings: $600 for four issues (~75 character limit), payable in ETH/DAI/USDC to abcoathup.eth on mainnet/Arbitrum/Optimism. Pay with
one click using 3cities. Questions? abcoathup at-gmail
• US government employees holding crypto restricted from participating in crypto regulation
• Jake Chervinsky: predictions for US SEC in Q3/Q4 , exchange rule to be finalized in October and new enforcement actions before end of
• Three Arrows Capital (3AC) filed for Chapter 15 bankruptcy in New York
• Former Celsius asset manager alleges that Celsius is a ponzi
• Class action lawsuit against Solana alleges unregistered security sold to retail
• Chrome zero-day : heap overflow vulnerability in WebRTC component
• Chinese data leak of 1 billion residents, apparently due to credentials published in a blog
• Balaji Srinivasan’s book The Network State released
• NIST selects quantum-resistant algorithms : CRYSTALS-Kyber for general encryption and CRYSTALS-Dilithium, FALCON & SPHINCS+ for digital
Follow @WeekinEthNews to find out what the most clicked links are. Follow @evan_van_ness and @abcoathup to get most of the week’s news in
• Jul 14 – Devcon ticket auction & raffle ends
• Jul 17 – EF Fellowship program applications close
Sign up to receive this newsletter weekly
